meanings.definition: To dig up (a buried body) incorrectly or unlawfully.
meanings.sent1: The gravedigger was caught misinterring the body in the dead of night.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist accidentally misinterred the ancient remains while excavating.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy detective ended up misinterring the wrong grave during the investigation.
meanings.sent4: The treasure hunter felt like he was misinterring secrets of the past with each shovel of dirt.
meanings.sent5: The villagers were horrified by the rumors of someone misinterring the graves in the cemetery.

meanings.definition: To uncover or bring to light something that was buried or hidden.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rainstorm misinterred the long-lost artifacts buried beneath the old ruins.
meanings.sent2: The curious child misinterred a hidden box of treasures in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The playful dog seemed to have a talent for misinterring buried bones in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected discovery misinterred a forgotten chapter of history for the researchers.
meanings.sent5: The old map promised to misinter the buried treasure for those brave enough to seek it.
